intro: Sanguisorba diandra var. diandra, commonly known as red sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and dense clusters of small, reddish-pink to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces slender, cylindrical seed capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sanguisorba diandra var. diandra is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
